profiles.name: Jane Eyre
clues: Published during the Victorian era under a male pseudonym
The protagonist works as a governess for a mysterious employer
Features a character with a hidden past locked away in an attic
Explores themes of independence and social class in 19th century England
Written by a British author from the BrontÃ« family
The main character experiences a significant fire that changes her fate
Contains a romantic relationship between the governess and employer
The narrative is told from the protagonist's perspective
Set partially in a mansion called Thornfield Hall
Features a love triangle with St. John Rivers
The heroine refuses to compromise her principles for love
Contains supernatural elements including mysterious laughter
The title character's first name becomes her identity throughout the story
Published in 1847 as a novel
Influenced many feminist literary works that followed
The protagonist is orphaned and mistreated in her youth
Features gothic atmosphere and dark secrets
The story explores what equality means in marriage
A classic of English literature still widely taught in schools
The ending suggests hope and equality for the main character

profiles.name: The Great Gatsby
clues: Set during the Jazz Age in 1920s New York
Features a narrator who moves to Long Island
The protagonist is a self-made millionaire with mysterious wealth
Explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream
Contains lavish parties in a mansion
The main character fell in love with a woman from his past
Green light symbolizes the protagonist's desire and longing
Written by an American author known for depicting excess
The love interest is married to a wealthy but brutal man
Set in fictional towns based on Long Island
The story ends tragically with the protagonist's death
Features East Egg and West Egg as contrasting settings
The narrator is a bond salesman
Published in 1925
Contains a doctor as one of the main characters
The protagonist's real name is not Gatsby
Explores the corruption of the American Dream
Features a yellow car that becomes symbolically important
The woman at the center of the story is careless with her power
Considered one of the greatest American novels ever written

profiles.name: Jack Torrance
clues: Character from a horror novel by Stephen King
Works as a winter caretaker in an isolated setting
Struggles with alcoholism throughout his life
Possesses a supernatural ability called the shining
His violent outbursts are influenced by his surroundings
Wife is named Wendy
Has a young son with similar psychic abilities
Gradually loses his sanity due to isolation and supernatural forces
The setting includes a hedge maze
Features a famous typewriter in the narrative
His descent into madness is both psychological and supernatural
Becomes increasingly dangerous as the story progresses
The spirits of the location manipulate his thoughts
He is portrayed as complex rather than purely evil
His story explores themes of addiction and domestic violence
The character's past includes traumatic childhood experiences
He attempts to harm his family members
The story is set during winter with no escape possible
His transformation is gradual and horrifying
The novel examines how environments can corrupt the human soul

profiles.name: Pride and Prejudice
clues: Written by a British female author in the early 19th century
The story begins with a famous opening line about marriage
Features a protagonist who judges others too quickly
Set in Regency England with strict social hierarchies
The main character is named Elizabeth
Contains a proud and wealthy male character named Fitzwilliam
Features first proposals that are rejected
The story involves five sisters seeking advantageous marriages
Contains misunderstandings that drive the plot forward
The protagonist initially despises the male lead
Explores class differences and social expectations
Features letters that reveal important information
The main couple eventually sees past their initial impressions
Published in 1813
Contains themes of personal growth and self-awareness
Features visits to grand estates like Pemberley
The protagonist is headstrong and independent for her time
Contains comic relief through family members
The story emphasizes finding love based on genuine connection
Remains one of the most beloved romance novels in English literature

profiles.name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
clues: Magical realism novel by a Colombian author
Set in the fictional town of Macondo
Features multiple generations of the same family
Characters often have the same names, creating cyclical patterns
Blends fantastical elements with realistic narrative
The town experiences various transformations throughout history
A woman ascends to heaven while folding laundry
Features an old gypsy who returns with magical discoveries
The narrative covers approximately 100 years of family history
Contains biblical and mythological references
A plague of insomnia affects the entire town
The story uses non-linear storytelling techniques
Published in 1967 and became an international bestseller
The narrative is told from a detached, all-knowing perspective
Features incest as a recurring theme within the family
The town is isolated from the outside world
A final manuscript reveals the story's conclusion
The novel influenced countless writers and defined a genre
Contains elements of solitude and isolation as central themes
Considered one of the greatest novels of the 20th century
